name: Message Header
description: The MSH segment defines the intent, source, destination, and some specifics of the syntax of a message.

fields.name: Field Separator
fields.description: Defines the character used as field separator for the rest of the message. Always '|'.

fields.name: Encoding Characters
fields.description: The four encoding characters used in the message: component (^), repetition (~), escape (\), and subcomponent (&).

fields.name: Sending Application
fields.description: Identifies the sending application among all other applications within the network enterprise.

fields.name: Sending Facility
fields.description: Identifies the sending facility (hospital, clinic, lab, etc.).

fields.name: Receiving Application
fields.description: Identifies the receiving application among all applications within the network enterprise.

fields.name: Receiving Facility
fields.description: Identifies the receiving facility (hospital, clinic, lab, etc.).

fields.name: Date/Time of Message
fields.description: Date and time that the sending system created the message.

fields.name: Security
fields.description: Used to implement security features.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: The message type, trigger event, and message structure.

fields.name: Message Control ID
fields.description: Unique message identifier used for acknowledgment.

fields.name: Processing ID
fields.description: Indicates whether the message is part of a production, training, or debugging system.

fields.name: Version ID
fields.description: The HL7 version used for encoding the message.

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: A non-null value in this field implies that the sequence number protocol is in use.

fields.name: Continuation Pointer
fields.description: Used to define continuations in application-specific ways.

fields.name: Accept Acknowledgment Type
fields.description: Defines the conditions under which accept acknowledgments are required.

fields.name: Application Acknowledgment Type
fields.description: Defines the conditions under which application acknowledgments are required.

fields.name: Country Code
fields.description: The country of origin for the message.

fields.name: Character Set
fields.description: The character set(s) used in the message.

fields.name: Principal Language of Message
fields.description: The principal language of the message.

fields.name: Alternate Character Set Handling Scheme
fields.description: Specifies an alternate character set handling scheme.

fields.name: Message Profile Identifier
fields.description: Sites may use this field to assert adherence to a message profile.
